title: Travel & Globalization
description: Learn vocabulary for discussing international travel, cultural exchange, and global issues.

words.meaning: the place to which someone is traveling
words.example: Paris remains one of the world's most popular tourist destinations.

words.meaning: a planned route or schedule of a journey
words.example: Our itinerary includes visits to three different countries.

words.meaning: the process of international integration
words.example: Globalization has transformed how businesses operate worldwide.

words.meaning: movement of people to a new area or country
words.example: Mass migration has reshaped many urban centers.

words.meaning: official department that controls imports; or traditional practices
words.example: We'll need to go through customs when we arrive.

words.meaning: official residence of an ambassador
words.example: Contact your embassy if you lose your passport abroad.

words.meaning: official permission to enter a country
words.example: By next month, I will have obtained my travel visa.

words.meaning: a place to live or stay
words.example: We've booked accommodation near the city center.

words.meaning: able to continue without causing damage
words.example: Sustainable tourism aims to minimize environmental impact.

words.meaning: showing a great deal of variety
words.example: The city has a diverse population from many backgrounds.

words.meaning: originating from a distant foreign country
words.example: They visited exotic locations throughout Southeast Asia.

words.meaning: genuine and true to its origins
words.example: We wanted an authentic cultural experience.

words.meaning: relating to many different cultures
words.example: London is one of the most multicultural cities in the world.

words.meaning: mutually joined or related
words.example: Our world is becoming increasingly interconnected.

words.meaning: far away from main centers; isolated
words.example: They explored remote villages in the mountains.

words.meaning: to travel through unfamiliar areas
words.example: We'll be exploring ancient ruins throughout our trip.

words.meaning: to adjust to new conditions
words.example: Travelers must adapt to different cultural norms.

words.meaning: to come to live permanently in a foreign country
words.example: Many families immigrate seeking better opportunities.

words.meaning: to combine or be combined into a whole
words.example: Immigrants often work hard to integrate into new societies.

words.meaning: to find one's way; to direct the course
words.example: Modern apps help travelers navigate unfamiliar cities.

words.meaning: valued traditions passed down through generations
words.example: UNESCO protects world heritage sites.

words.meaning: a recognizable feature of a place
words.example: The Eiffel Tower is Paris's most famous landmark.

words.meaning: a style of cooking
words.example: We sampled the local cuisine everywhere we visited.

words.meaning: money used in a particular country
words.example: You'll need to exchange your currency before traveling.

words.meaning: tiredness after a long flight across time zones
words.example: It takes days to recover from jet lag.

words.meaning: an object kept as a reminder of a place visited
words.example: She collects souvenirs from every country she visits.

words.meaning: including people from many different countries
words.example: Singapore is a truly cosmopolitan city.

words.meaning: originating naturally in a particular place
words.example: We learned about indigenous cultures during our trip.

words.meaning: friendly treatment of guests
words.example: The local hospitality was remarkable throughout our stay.

words.meaning: crossing a continent
words.example: By next year, we will have completed our transcontinental journey.

words.meaning: a journey undertaken for a specific purpose
words.example: The scientific expedition explored the Amazon rainforest.

words.meaning: a strong desire to travel and explore the world
words.example: Her wanderlust has taken her to over fifty countries.

words.meaning: a traveler carrying belongings in a backpack
words.example: Many backpackers stay in hostels to save money.

words.meaning: a person living outside their native country
words.example: She's an expatriate working in Hong Kong.

words.meaning: a person forced to leave their country due to danger
words.example: The refugee crisis requires international cooperation.

words.meaning: to absorb and integrate into a new culture
words.example: It can take years to assimilate into a new culture.

words.meaning: able to speak two languages fluently
words.example: Being bilingual is a great advantage when traveling.

words.meaning: a regional variety of a language
words.example: Each region has its own distinct dialect.

words.meaning: customary rules of polite behavior
words.example: Understanding local etiquette is important when traveling.

words.meaning: deep involvement in a particular activity or culture
words.example: Language immersion programs are very effective.

words.meaning: tourism focused on environmental conservation
words.example: Ecotourism promotes responsible travel to natural areas.

words.meaning: excessive tourism causing negative impacts
words.example: Venice struggles with the effects of overtourism.

words.meaning: the process of traveling through a place
words.example: We had a brief transit stop in Dubai.

words.meaning: a stop between flights or journeys
words.example: We have a three-hour layover in Frankfurt.

words.meaning: a border between countries or unexplored region
words.example: The frontier regions are difficult to access.

words.meaning: relating to different cultures
words.example: Cross-cultural communication skills are essential in business.

words.meaning: willingness to accept different beliefs or behaviors
words.example: Cultural tolerance is vital in multicultural societies.

words.meaning: preconceived opinion not based on reason
words.example: Travel can help break down cultural prejudice.

words.meaning: a widely held but oversimplified image or idea
words.example: We should avoid cultural stereotypes when traveling.

words.meaning: involving or representing different cultures
words.example: Intercultural dialogue promotes global understanding.

pairs.match: a planned route or schedule of a journey
valued traditions passed down through generations
originating naturally in a particular place
including people from many different countries
